pylabel.name: pylabel
pylabel.description: Transform, analyze, and visualize computer vision annotations.

repo.name: pylabel
repo.description: Python library for computer vision labeling tasks. The core functionality is to translate bounding box annotations between different formats-for example, from coco to yolo.

readme.summary: Excellent clarity and examples with strong quick-start code, but completely missing installation instructions and troubleshooting guidance.
readme.top_issue: No installation instructions provided - users must guess to run 'pip install pylabel' or find it elsewhere

common_complaints: Missing features (YOLO segmentation support)
Bugs in analysis functions (ShowClassSplits returning empty dataframes)
Unclear API behavior (optional parameters causing failures)
Performance issues (slow operations without progress feedback)
Data loss during operations (AssertionError on splitter)
Limited input flexibility (single image extension support)
sentiment.summary: The pylabel project shows signs of abandonment with multiple unresolved bugs, feature requests left open for 18+ months, zero maintainer engagement visible in recent issues, and fundamental functionality problems (empty dataframes, data loss errors) that suggest the project is no longer actively maintained.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months (last commit August 2024)
13 open issues with no recent resolution
Zero closed issues in past 6 months
No merged PRs in past 6 months
No active contributors in past 6 months
maintenance.summary: pylabel shows clear signs of abandonment with no development activity, issue resolution, or contributor engagement over the past 6 months.

project_metrics.description: Python library for computer vision labeling tasks. The core functionality is to translate bounding box annotations between different formats-for example, from coco to yolo.

concerns: High bus factor risk (92% from top contributor)

repo.name: taskiq-redis
repo.description: Broker and result backend for taskiq

readme.summary: Excellent clarity and quick start with comprehensive broker explanations, but lacks troubleshooting guidance and could use more real-world examples.
readme.top_issue: No troubleshooting section - common issues like connection failures, Redis configuration problems, or worker startup errors are not documented

common_complaints: Memory management issues (stream growing unbounded, OOM kills)
Long-running task handling with automatic redelivery causing duplication
Scheduling functionality bugs (interval schedules not executing, cron tasks failing)
Missing features for Redis Sentinel support
Incompatible version requirements (Redis 6 dropped, Python 3.9 support removed)
praise_themes: Community engagement with custom implementations and PRs
Modernization efforts (moving to uv, dropping deprecated Python)
sentiment.summary: Active project with moderate responsiveness showing growing pains around streaming broker reliability and scheduling edge cases, but recent maintenance activity and closed issues indicate ongoing development.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent (2025-12-19)
21 open issues with no recent activity or closure
Zero closed issues in past 6 months indicating no maintenance
No merged PRs in past 6 months showing no development activity
No active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests release information is missing or stale
maintenance.summary: Package appears abandoned with no maintenance activity over the past 6 months despite a recent commit timestamp that may indicate outdated or incomplete metadata.

project_metrics.description: Broker and result backend for taskiq

cves.summary: ansible-runner vulnerable to shell command injection
A flaw was found in ansible-runner. An improper escaping of the shell command, while calling the ansible_runner.interface.run_command, can lead to parameters getting executed as host's shell command.
ansible-runner vulnerable to Race Condition
ansible-runner has default temporary files written to world R/W locations

A flaw was found in ansible-runner where the default temporary files configuration in ansible-2.0.0 are written to world R/W locations. This flaw allows an attacker to pre-create the directory, result

A race condition flaw was found in ansible-runner, where an attacker could watch for rapid creation and deletion of a temporary directory, substitute their directory at that name, and then have access

project_metrics.description: A tool and python library that helps when interfacing with Ansible directly or as part of another system whether that be through a container image interface, as a standalone tool, or as a Python module that can be imported. project_metrics.description: H2O is an Open Source, Distributed, Fast & Scalable Machine Learning Platform: Deep Learning, Gradient Boosting (GBM) & XGBoost, Random Forest, Generalized Linear Modeling (GLM with Elastic Net), K-Means, PCA, Generalized Additive Models (GAM), RuleFit, Support Vector Machine (SVM), Stacked Ensembles, Automatic Machine Learning (AutoML), etc.

datacontract-cli.name: datacontract-cli
datacontract-cli.description: The datacontract CLI is an open source command-line tool for working with Data Contracts. It uses data contract YAML files to lint the data contract, connect to data sources and execute schema and quality tests, detect breaking changes, and export to different formats. The tool is written in Python. It can be used as a standalone CLI tool, in a CI/CD pipeline, or directly as a Python library.
